entries.title: Public Health Agency Claims Mandatory ArriveCan Saved Travellers Time
entries.description: A Canada Border Services Agency officer hands documents back to a motorist entering Canada at the Douglas-Peace Arch border crossing in Surrey, B.C., on Aug. 9, 2021. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

entries.title: Novak Djokovic Primed for Australian Open Tilt
entries.description: Serbia's Novak Djokovic celebrates after winning the final match against Sebastian Korda of the U.S., at the Adelaide International, in Adelaide, Australia, on Jan. 8, 2023. (Loren Elliott/Reuters)

entries.title: White House Responds After Pro-Bolsonaro Protesters Breach Brazilian Congress
entries.description: Security forces confront supporters of Brazilian former President Jair Bolsonaro as they invade Planalto Presidential Palace in Brasilia on January 8, 2023.( SERGIO LIMA/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: LIVE 7:30 PM ET: Biden Arrives in Mexico Ahead of North America Summit
entries.description: President Joe Biden boards Air Force One at Joint Base Andrews in Maryland on Jan. 8, 2023. (Jim Watson/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: ‘Preppers’: Survival Classes Help People Prepare for the Worst
entries.description: An aerial photo showing flooded farms along the Trans-Canada Highway in Abbotsford, B.C., on Nov. 22, 2021. (The Canadian Press/Darryl Dyck)

entries.title: Death of Chinese Official Amid COVID Wave Casts Spotlight on Forced Organ Harvesting
entries.description: Falun Gong practitioners in Vienna, Austria, stage a mock demonstration of organ harvesting of imprisoned practitioners in China during a protest against the importing of human organs from China to Austria, on Oct. 1, 2018. (Joe Klamar/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Trudeau Commits to Seeking Justice for Flight PS752 Victims on Three-Year Anniversary
entries.description: People grieve during a ceremony marking the three-year anniversary of the downing of flight PS752, in Toronto on Jan. 8, 2023. (The Canadian Press/Christopher Katsarov)

entries.title: Bolsonaro Supporters Breach Brazil’s Congress Building, Presidential Palace
entries.description: Supporters of Brazilian former President Jair Bolsonaro clash with the police during a demonstration outside Brazil's National Congress headquarters in Brasilia, Brazil, on Jan. 8, 2023. (Evaristo Sa/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Canadians Asked to Avoid Non-Essential Travel to Mexican Regions Due to Violence After Drug Cartel Arrest
entries.description: A truck burns after being set on fire amid an eruption of violence following the arrest of Ovidio Guzman Lopez, an alleged high-ranking member of a Mexican drug trafficking cartel, in Culiacan, Sinaloa, Mexico, on Jan. 5, 2023. (Martin Urista/AP Photo)

entries.title: China Needs to Know the Economic Consequences If It Invades Taiwan: Former NATO Chief
entries.description: Former NATO Secretary General Anders Fogh Rasmussen. (Sean Gallup/Getty Images)

entries.title: Anthony Furey: Concern Over Canada’s Immigration Targets Becomes Mainstream
entries.description: Immigration, Refugees, and Citizenship Minister Sean Fraser rises during Question Period in the House of Commons on Parliament Hill in Ottawa on  May 12, 2022. (The Canadian Press/ Patrick Doyle)

entries.title: UK’s Sunak Demands ‘Bold and Radical’ Action to Ease Winter Crisis in Hospitals
entries.description: Ambulances at St Thomas' Hospital in London, England, on Jan. 7, 2022. (Dan Kitwood/Getty Images)

entries.title: Canadians to Mark Third Anniversary of Flight PS752 Downing at Countrywide Ceremonies
entries.description: A mourner lights candles during a memorial for the anniversary of flight PS752 in Edmonton on Jan. 8, 2021. (The Canadian Press/Jason Franson)

entries.title: China to Reopen Border to Hong Kong Amid Beijing COVID Outbreak
entries.description: Travellers walk with their luggage at the departure hall of the Hong Kong International Airport in Hong Kong on Dec. 30, 2022. (Anthony Kwan/Getty Images)

entries.title: Western Australia’s Major Gas Plant Experiences Sudden Failure
entries.description: An undated handout photo shows Australian resources giant Woodside's Cossack Pioneer oil production facility in the North West Shelf gas project in Western Australia. (-/AFP via Getty Images)

entries.title: Australian Tennis Star Ash Barty Announces Pregnancy
entries.description: Ash Barty of Australia celebrates after defeating Jessica Pegula of the United States in their quarterfinal match at the Australian Open tennis championships in Melbourne, Australia, on Jan. 25, 2022. (Hamish Blair/AP Photo)

entries.title: Brazilian ‘Mad Dog’ Freire Killed in Nazare
entries.description: A surfer rides a wave in Praia do Norte, Nazare, Portugal, on Feb. 25, 2022. (Pedro Nunes/Reuters)

entries.title: Pakistan Frees 524 Afghan Illegal Immigrants From Karachi Jail
entries.description: The locator map for Pakistan with its capital, Islamabad, and the Kashmir region. (AP Photo)

entries.title: Putin Praises Russian Orthodox Church for Backing Troops in Ukraine
entries.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin attends the Orthodox Christmas service at the Kremlin in Moscow on Jan. 7, 2023. (Sputnik/Mikhail Klimentyev/Kremlin via Reuters)

entries.title: Germany, Norway Reach Agreement on Blue Hydrogen Supplies
entries.description: FILE PHOTO: Norwegian energy company Equinor's flag is seen at its headquarters in Stavanger, Norway,  December 5, 2019. REUTERS/Ints Kalnins/File Photo

entries.title: Flood in Australia’s North Concerns Ease, Ex-cyclone Weakens
entries.description: AUSTRALIA - JULY 26:  The Northern Territory town of Tennant Creek, population 3,000. (Ross Land/Getty Images)
